intro: Nasturtium commutatum, commonly known as the Indian nasturtium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Tropaeolaceae. It is native to the Himalayas and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that come in shades of orange and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces edible seeds that are often used in culinary applications. Its flowers and leaves are also known for their peppery taste, similar to that of watercress. Nasturtium commutatum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant and for its edible parts.
